annotation.TEXT: Alright, it's final boss time!
Argh! I fell into the red stuff and got an "unsatisfactory" mark on my testing record, followed by death...
You're welcome!
No, I think the credits are about the makers of the game. Why would they be about me? (I already explained that that "SomeGuy" wasn't me.)

You'd think Ninji would appear with the Mechakoopas, since they can appear the same sprite set. Did Nintendo really overlook Ninji in this sequence? Wow, I never noticed that Ninji was left out of this before...
The first time I grabbed the koopa like that as I was dying occurred completely by chance. The second time was intentional.
Also, I just want to point out something real quick: Shouldn't that say "NINJI START!"? (Note: WMM was used to make "MARIO START!" linger for a few extra seconds.)

Yeah, when standing still, everything looks normal, but while moving, Ninji changes into a purple Mario. Obviously, Yoshi wasn't intended for OW travel here. However, even without doing that trick I did at the end, you can easily get Yoshi on the OW by replaying that level and then Start+Selecting.
Oh, are the backgrounds fixed now? Good.
Uh, what? Did that clown car linger around in the background more than usual?
This isn't because I did that message box thing at the beginning of the Zookeeper fight, is it?
Huh. Seems like a lot of games' graphics were used here.
Umm... And the background is remaining red. That's... not normal. Well, whatever.
Wow, two gutter balls? You're as bad as Bowser! (Of course, having an opponent that knows how to dodge doesn't help!)
Okay, I don't really have any more time to waste, so I'm going to skip past these guys.
There's even a tiny bit of glitchiness here if you look close enough.
Also, you'll notice that there's no ending message here. That's normal. (However, the crazy clown car in the background is definitely not normal!)
Okay, let's try this again...
Dang, can't kill Magikoopa by farting...
What? It's a little alien from Commander Keen! You're the Zookeeper?!
MOOOONNNOMNOMNOM!!!
It's... boss time? No, it's Yoshi time! Hi, Yoshi!
24-life combo! Yeah, I tool-assisted that corner clip! But hey, I proved that the moons were reachable!
Yeah, the Yoshi jump method works very well, even with a parakoopa in the way!
So, the Zookeeper was Bowser all along! That explains their identical abilities. However, it doesn't explain how Bowser was able to fit into that tiny alien costume...
Close call there! Okay, now to force feed those Chucks my farts!
And let's watch the credits roll.
That is weird, though. How did these backgrounds get messed up like that?
Whoa! I tried to bounce off the parakoopa, and it sort of worked, though not as I expected.
Triple kill!
Well, at least Mario, Luigi, and Peach were replaced with a Ninji silhouette here.
Alright, now that I have Yoshi, I want to revisit this level. There's a very good reason why...
Umm... That's not the reason I wanted to revisit that level. Those jumps are tricky with Yoshi. You've got to jump like at the very edge of the block to make it, or maybe do a well-aimed Yoshi jump.
And the enemy cast is pretty much the same, except for some glitchy backgrounds for some reason.
Umm... That "SomeGuy" there is not me, just so you know. (This hack was made in 2005, and I first played it in March 2009, four months before I created my YouTube account.)
Oh, and you don't get a lot of time in this level, so pick up the pace!
That was actually close. It looked like that one nearly hit my head.
Demo count: 3
What, indeed?
Demo count: 1
Ah, good. The background has returned to normal. I wonder why the red color stuck around like that in the first place?
Hello, and welcome to the finale of The Ninji Saga! Before I resume the story, I'm going to go back to Mt. Mystic to show a trick that I didn't show before, and that addax12345 mentioned to me.
Hey, for more silliness, let's see what happens if I hold up during the screen transition here!
And now the clown car's doing that weird thing in the background again.
Now, this is what I came back here for! So, the laser normally would insta-kill me, but shells can pass through it... Maybe I can pass through it while riding Yoshi?
Now, as I was saying, bring a shell down here with you, and carefully avoid the fish. Don't lose the shell!
Well, I guess I shouldn't judge by appearances, since you appear to be exactly as strong as SMW's Bowser.
Nuts. I guess the splitting Chucks weren't hungry.
Well, I hope you all enjoyed watching me play through The Ninji Saga. Bye, everybody!
Hmm... What happens if I hit the message box, then enter the door at the exact instant the message would appear? (Tool-assisted.)
Okay, that's weird. Is that a side effect of the message box thing I did?
Woo, first try! Now for some fun!
Demo count: 2
Wait, what? What the heck's going on with the clown car in the background?! (I broke into hysterical laughter at this point!)
Okay, Zookeeper, show yourself!
I get a blank message on a red background. Okay...
And that's game!
Now, Yoshi functions just like he always does, and this is only way you can take a hit without dying in this game, as there are no power ups.
Man, it so seems like there should be a sequel to this game...
You don't scare me, ZK! I've got Yoshi on my side!
Huzzah! The door leads straight to the level being cleared, so you've won as soon as you enter it.
Eat my farts, Chucks!
(There's more hysterical laughter from me at this point!)
Nope, that didn't work. LOL at what Yoshi's tongue decides to take with him, though!

Oh, and this glitchy object that other Ninji throws out is just a coin. (That actually is mentioned in the text file that comes with the game. Apparently, the maker couldn't fix the coin graphics without screwing up other graphics at the time.)
D'oh! I guess we're not done with the glitchy backgrounds yet.
I think the Yoshi jump method is more reliable. Oh, yeah, now the game gives me a blue koopa, after I don't need it anymore. Also, Yoshi's tongue graphics are glitched.
Okay, I guess I'll have to do this without Yoshi. At least Ninji by himself has less than 1000 attack points, so that Trap Hole won't work on him!
Nope, that didn't work. Also, LOL again at the "I'm taking you with me" tongue grab!
Alright, time to get back to the main game here. Let's enter Galaxy Zoo West.
Hahaha... Okay, there's a new catchphrase for me! Did I mention how awesome these credits are?
Bye, Magikoopa!
That was kind of cool. Okay, now if sprites can pass through the laser, but I can't, hmm...
So, it's me and Yoshi vs. the Zookeeper. Here we go!

Yeah, so this is basically your standard SMW Bowser fight. I thought about speeding it up and/or switching the music, but I think enough silly things occur during the fight to keep it interesting without any editing!
And now for the usual Bowling tournament that comes in the middle of this battle.

15-life combo! And there you go! If you're even halfway-decent at block cloning, then this is a great place to build up lives. (If you're not, you could either play the Prologue repeatedly, or use the star in 1-1 Generations for extra lives.)
Fast forward!!!
And then I go and waste time killing a Thwomp. It was totally worth it!
Gulp! Um, what happened here? Yoshi's losing his head over these unexpected graphical glitches!
Hahaha!!! Wow, he looks silly when he gets hit!
Still glitchy.
Huh, it appears that I can "swim" in the laser when I jump into it from below, so maybe I can just jump out?
I can certainly kill him that way, but I've wasted quite a bit of time there!
It's stompy time! Man, that must be one strong propeller to not snap off or otherwise break somehow after being slammed into the floor so many times!
Well, guess what, ZK? I just happen to be a trained keeper! (Yes, us Ninjis do secretly train in the art of Yoshi handling!)
Yay, we're back home, with Yoshis all around! (I told you that us Ninjis secretly train with Yoshis. We just never revealed this skill during the official Mario games.)
I'm scrolling back up and then down again here to make sure that all of the possible coins (that were fish) have a chance to spawn.
Gah, even knowing they're there, I still couldn't grab most of those...
Freaky.
There's the exit door, but it's too small for Yoshi to get through! ...Or is it?
Unfortunately, I don't think those fireworks are capable of shooting down that clown car...
I'm not giving up yet. There's got to be a way!
Also, bringing Yoshi with me causes an oddity on the overworld...
WAAHH!!! Unfortunately, ZK had set a Trap Hole card down, and Yoshi did have over 1000 attack points...
Oh, I just thought of something... Does the "Ninji" enemy appear at all in this SMW enemy cast sequence? If it does, let me know, but I don't think I'm seeing it here.
Alright, now that I've got my moons, let's saddle up for the final level!
Demo count: 4
These credits are awesome, by the way!
Push! Yes, it's peanut butter jelly time! Er... I mean, silver coin collecting time!
Alright, now if you use the shell to block clone this block to the left, you'll get a silver potion. Guess what that acts like!
Okay, now at this point, if you take a shell with you to the lower area (or an ice block, but they'll eventually melt, so I recommend a shell), and carefully avoid the fish...
Now, how do I get out of here? I could Start+Select, but that's the boring way...
